headline.main: LEWIS AIDE SAYS WHITE HOUSE GOT NO PLAN ON CURBING ACID RAIN

byline.original: By PHILIP SHABECOFF, Special to the New York Times

docs.lead_paragraph: No recommendations have yet been presented to the White House by the President Reagan's special representative on acid rain, Drew Lewis, his spokesman said today. The spokesman, William Russo, said by telephone that Mr. Lewis had not made any report to the White House yet because he had not yet decided on a plan for dealing with the environmental problem. Last Friday, in a meeting with governors of six New England states, Mr. Lewis observed, ''Saying that sulfates do not cause acid rain is the same as saying that smoking does not cause lung cancer.''
